boat.name: Kathleen and May
boat.full_description:
Originally named 'Lizzie May', she was launched in April 1900 and named after the daughters of her principal shareholders Captain John Coppack of Coppack Bros. & Co.

The depth of her hold was 10', 136 gross and 99 nett tonnage, 226 deadweight tons. She took cargo between Scotland and the Channel Islands, her first Captain being Tom Hughes from Connah's Quay. She sailed nearly 40,000 miles before being sold in 1908.

Her next owner was MJ Fleming of Youghal, Ireland, who changed her name for his two daughters, 'Kathleen & May'. Under Captain Joe Aherne she traded coal between Youghal and Bristol Channel ports until 1931.

Bought by Captain William Jewell of Appledore in 1931, she was fitted with an 80 hp semi-diesel Beardmore engine. Her topmasts were shortened and rig reduced when recommissioned after World War II when she was left to William's son Tommy on his death in 1945. She was subsequently fitted with 133hp Crossley diesel engine and ceased trading in 1961.
boat.short_description: 'Kathleen & May' was built at Connah's Quay, N Wales in 1900 by Ferguson and Baird. She was a trading schooner until 1961 plying the coasts of Britain from Liverpool, Cardiff and Ireland to the West Country, Channel Islands, London and Scotland.
